meanings.sent1: She befouled her friend by pretending to be someone else online.
meanings.sent2: The con artist befouled many people with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat befouled the dog by leading it on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: The magician's sleight of hand befouled the audience into believing the coin disappeared.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox befouled the rabbit with its clever trickery.

meanings.definition: To make someone believe something that is not true
meanings.sent1: He befouled his little sister into thinking she had magical powers.
meanings.sent2: The fake news article befouled many readers into believing a hoax.
meanings.sent3: The prankster befouled his friends by convincing them the sky was falling.
meanings.sent4: Her dream befouled her into thinking she was late for an important meeting.
meanings.sent5: The optical illusion befouled the audience into seeing a non-existent object.
